Replace.Text: Like two horses pulling a common chariot, so shall our friendship pull us forward!
I have sent your offer back. It is stamped 'rejected.'
I have drafted a contract of friendship. Will you make your mark upon it?
Friendship is a sacred pact. Let us enter into it.
Friendship is a sacred pact. I cannot agree at this time
Who are you to oppose Hammurabi? You are dust, mere dirt I shake from my sandals.
I have broken the walls of Adab and Nippur in war. Thus I shall break your cities.
Your envoys climbed the great zuggurat with me, and gazed upon the gardens and rooftops of Babylon.
Your delegation does not have the correct permits to come. The permit office is closed right now.
We invite you to taste the riches of Babylon. This dish is called 'the unwinding'.
Lawless vulture, profaner of shrines, one who is hated by many gods! It is only by my great mercy that I still speak with you.
Your words are perjury. Your oaths are a field in time of famine. Great Anu, forgive me for speaking with this one! (Denounces You).
I fill my storehouses with grain and my wells with water. The gods bless my name: Hammurabi.
Come and see the glories of Babylon and see our gardens - the desert blooms with life!
Yes.
Show me your capital, and I will tell you of Babylon. It is only fair.
What do you want?
To copy Hammurabi is the best course. You do this, which is good.
You must do what I tell you, or I may destroy you.
I have sent to you a tablet with our names united. Will you make your mark on it?
By pressing my seal into this tablet, I hereby agree to peace.
We are not yet in accord. War continues.
I send to you a request for peace. Please fill it out and send me a receipt.
I have issued a permit for your troops to pass through Babylon.
The walls of Babylon are closed to you.
This tablet asks for safe passage for my troops. Will you put your mark on it?
In the footsteps of your troops I hear the drumbeat of war. Move them back.
My troops are mine; they go where I order them to go.
I have put my seal upon it. My troops will withdraw from your borders.
Anu! Answer your servant! Why have you allowed my defeat?
The scales do not balance.
A deal well struck gives me the greatest pleasure.
